Class Rocket

java.lang.Object
  Rocket

public class Rocket
extends java.lang.Object

Class Rocket allows a representation of a rocket to be created in the Shapes Window, and for it to move up the screen. This class is incomplete.

Version:
(1.1)
Author:
(M250 Course Team)

Constructor Summary
Rocket(Triangle t, Square s, Circle c)
          Constructor for objects of class Rocket
 
Method Summary
 void animateRocket(int speed)
          Moves the entire rocket in a loop repeated 100 times, animating the jet as it goes, so the rocket moves upwards by speed units every 4th iteration
 void delay(int time)
          Causes execution to pause by time number of milliseconds
 void ignition()
          Simulates the ignition of the rocket's jets
 void launch()
          Prompts the user to enter the number of units they want the rocket to move upwards at a time (speed) If the number of units provided would eventually cause the tip of the nose to go past the top of the Graphical Display, the user is informed via a dialogue box that the rocket will not launch.
 void moveRocketBy(int anInt)
          Moves the nose of the receiver by anInt units.
 void pulse1()
          Sets the diameter of the receiver's jet to 6, alters its xPos so its centre aligns with the body centre and sets its colour to red.
 void pulse2()
          Sets the diameter of the receiver's jet to 12, alters its xPos so its centre aligns with the body centre and sets its colour to orange.
 void pulse3()
          Sets the diameter of the receiver's jet to 24, alters its xPos so its centre aligns with the body centre and sets its colour to red.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Rocket

public Rocket(Triangle t,
              Square s,
              Circle c)
Constructor for objects of class Rocket

Method Detail

animateRocket

public void animateRocket(int speed)
Moves the entire rocket in a loop repeated 100 times, animating the jet as it goes, so the rocket moves upwards by speed units every 4th iteration

delay

public void delay(int time)
Causes execution to pause by time number of milliseconds

ignition

public void ignition()
Simulates the ignition of the rocket's jets

launch

public void launch()
Prompts the user to enter the number of units they want the rocket to move upwards at a time (speed) If the number of units provided would eventually cause the tip of the nose to go past the top of the Graphical Display, the user is informed via a dialogue box that the rocket will not launch. Otherwise the rocket launches as required.

moveRocketBy

public void moveRocketBy(int anInt)
Moves the nose of the receiver by anInt units. Moves other rocket components relative to the position of the nose.

pulse1

public void pulse1()
Sets the diameter of the receiver's jet to 6, alters its xPos so its centre aligns with the body centre and sets its colour to red.

pulse2

public void pulse2()
Sets the diameter of the receiver's jet to 12, alters its xPos so its centre aligns with the body centre and sets its colour to orange.

pulse3

public void pulse3()
Sets the diameter of the receiver's jet to 24, alters its xPos so its centre aligns with the body centre and sets its colour to red.
